metadata.title: CVE-2018-11235 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
In Git before 2.13.7, 2.14.x before 2.14.4, 2.15.x before 2.15.2, 2.16.xbefore 2.16.4, and 2.17.x before 2.17.1, remote code execution can occur.With a crafted .gitmodules file, a malicious project can execute anarbitrary script on a machine that runs "git clone --recurse-submodules"because submodule "names" are obtained from this file, and then appended to$GIT_DIR/modules, leading to directory traversal with "../" in a name.Finally, post-checkout hooks from a submodule are executed, bypassing theintended design in which hooks are not obtained from a remote server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11235` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-all - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-arch - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-bzr - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-core - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-cvs - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-daemon-run - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-el - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-email - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-gui - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-man - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-mediawiki - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-svn - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
gitk - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
gitweb - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8').
